quotes.t: The necessaries of life for man in this climate may, accurately enough, be distributed under the several heads of Food, Shelter, Clothing, and Fuel; for not till we have secured these are we prepared to entertain the true problems of life with freedom and a prospect of {qword}success{/qword}.

An enormous popular and critical {qword}success{/qword}, {it}The Liars' Club{/it} was credited with (or blamed for) launching a new wave of memoir-writing. (Karr deflects this accusation: "I think memoir started with St. Augustine," she told Salon in 1997.)
Fred tries to keep up his end of the conversation, but without much {qword}success{/qword}; he has never grown bulbs, cooked veal, seen a film by Fassbinder, etc. He feels provincial and out of it …

Since I was interested in finding out about the {qword}successes{/qword} as well as the failures disabled women experience in the world, I interviewed women who had some work experience, although it was often part-time work and sometimes interrupted.

shortdef: favorable or desired outcome; also : the attainment of wealth, favor, or eminence

dt: {bc}a story of a person who rises to fortune, acclaim, or brilliant achievement

dt.t: In the world of finance, his is a great {it}success story{/it}.

dt: {bc}someone or something that has achieved a goal

dt.t: I am one of the diet clinic's {it}success stories{/it}.

dt: {bc}someone or something that has achieved wealth, respect, or fame

dt.t: That company is one of this area's biggest {it}success stories{/it}.

shortdef: a story of a person who rises to fortune, acclaim, or brilliant achievement
someone or something that has achieved a goal
someone or something that has achieved wealth, respect, or fame

dt: {bc}policies and an environment that encourage success

dt.t: There was a {it}culture of success{/it} at the school.

shortdef: policies and an environment that encourage success

dt.t: Did you {it}have any/much success{/it} in finding the dog?

dt: used to say that one success often results in another success

shortdef: —used to say that one success often results in another success

dt.t: She sacrificed honesty {it}on the altar of success{/it}.

shortdef: the reason someone is so successful

dt: {bc}without achieving what one tried to do {bc}unsuccessfully

dt.t: He tried to repair the engine but {it}without success{/it}.

shortdef: without achieving what one tried to do : unsuccessfully
